That's a great attitude to have! "The Great" is definitely a show that prioritizes entertainment and humor over strict historical accuracy, and it's wonderful that you're enjoying it for what it is.

The show's creators have said that they aimed to create a "anti-period drama" that subverts expectations and pokes fun at the genre's conventions. By taking creative liberties, they've managed to create a unique and refreshing take on a familiar historical figure.

The cast, including Elle Fanning and Nicholas Hoult, have also received praise for their performances, which add to the show's humor and charm. The show's writers have done an excellent job of crafting complex, relatable characters that are both historically inspired and modernly relevant.

It's great that you're not too bothered by the historical inaccuracies, as it allows you to focus on the storytelling and character development. Sometimes, it's nice to just sit back, relax, and enjoy a show without worrying too much about historical precision.

What do you think of the supporting cast, particularly Phoebe Fox as Marial and Sacha Dhawan as Orlo? They're both fantastic in their roles, and add a lot of depth and humor to the show.
